reviews.text: My husband, our 4-year-old son and I just came back from a trip to Jamaica (7/30-8/7/06). We had one MAJOR issue with our hotel but the trip itself was GREAT.
reviews.title: Sleep was hard to come by

likes.disliked: — The room windows did not block out noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Idle Awhile did NOT turn out to be IT for us. The whole concept of the hotel is a good one. Small, cute and intimate place nestled in gardens right on the gorgeous 7-mile beach.
reviews.title: This resort is the best

reviews.text: OUR ROOM: is the only reason why it turned out not be IT. This is a really affordable hotel, so I had originally planned on booking a suite for the space. However, I noticed that several Trip Advisor reviewers complained that there was no AC in the living room area, so one couldn't really enjoy sitting there as it would get too hot/humid (there's AC in the bedroom and FANS in the living room). The fact that we were going in August meant that the living room area would probably be unbearable, therefore a true waste of money. So I went with a regular room, gardenview.
reviews.title: A++ resort

reviews.text: And let the rant begin. We ended up in room 101 which is on the first floor and next to the main walkway that goes from the entrance to the beach. What's wrong with that, you say? Well, you should see the windows in EVERY room of this hotel. There's a screen to keep the bugs out, and then wooden shutters. That's it. So guess what? Sound is NOT blocked off. You can hear EVERY person talking and walking down the path (who knew so many people didn't pick up their feet when they walked?!).
reviews.title: The best!

reviews.text: At about 6pm, the cicadas/crickets/whatever would start singing and wouldn't stop till early morning. And they were LOUD (we did get used to them after a couple of days). My husband had an idea, suggested I drink 2 rum punches at night to knock me out. Don't laugh. I tried it I was so desperate for sleep! I could only drink one and I kinda/sorta slept better.
reviews.title: Beautiful Peace

reviews.text: We printed the review from 2/19 and followed it to a tee. We loved every minute of our vacation and everything about the hotel / beach and all the places that we visited - thank you to the person who took the time to write the review. This hotel is not for everyone. If you are high maintenance and don't like the sun then don't go to Idle Awhile. I travel often for business and stay in many 5 star hotels. Idle Awhile is different. It's unique. It's a GREAT find if you are casual, laid back and need a great place to relax, sit on the beach, float on a raft in the ocean or want to venture. You do not need to pack much. A bathing suit, flip flops, sunscreen and something casual to wear at night. Bring bug spray ("off" worked fine). Beautiful plush gardens on the property. I highly recommend: "Mis Sonia's" for patties - look for Mis Sonia out back making each Patty from scratch (even the dough!) and cooking each on wood burning, Norma's (crab back app. is great), Rockhouse for drinks/dinner (best food), pina colada's at Idle While made by the King - the best!!, sunsets on the beach, live reggae by Dolly Man and grilled lobster 2 doors down on the beach (Wed and Sun). Like everyone states in their reviews - the rooms were clean and spacious with great patios. Thanks to the gracious staff. Enjoy and relax. We did and we will be back.
reviews.title: No Problem

reviews.text: First timers to Negril - we normally vacation in Grand Case. St. Martin. We now realize we enjoy the smaller town feeling of Grand Case.
reviews.title: Nice place but like previous reviewer, Seven Mile Beach not for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have recently stayed 8 nights in Negril... the first 3 nights at Idle A While (I will be adding reviews of the 2 other accommodations which were both on the Cliffs). This was my third time to Negril and my husband's first. I'd only stayed on the cliffs before which I loved, but we wanted to experience both the beach and the cliffs on our first visit together to Negril. We're in our early 40s, have no kids, enjoy a party atmosphere but very much value quite times and our privacy. We never stay at an AI so we searched and searched Trip Advisor for the perfect spot on the beach. We found IAW and booked a room for a trip in Nov 2012. Then Hurricane Sandy came thru NY and we had to reschedule our trip for Jan 2013. Karim and everyone at IAW were very helpful in assisting us with the rebooking and did not charge us anything for having to cancel the original trip.
reviews.title: Our forever go-to spot on 7 Mile Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the excellent reviews you read here at Idle AWhile are true. Karim welcomes you in the office, and checks you in with no problem. You head out through the perfectly manicured gardens toward the beach bar where you are given your choice of a free welcome cocktail. We chose the rum punch. Three different kinds of rum and fruit punch. Very delicious and strong. Perfect welcome drink. We were a little early to check in but our room was ready 2 minutes later. We were in Room 202. We took our welcome drinks up to the room and loved what we saw. Ours was a deluxe garden view room. The room is the perfect blend of modern caribbean decor. The bathroom is open air, so very little privacy, but we've been in that situation before on vacation and well we have been together for so long neither of us mind saying, "Honey, can you go out on the balcony while I use the bathroom?" I loved the bathroom. The shower is open to the rest of the room which gives you so much space to bathe, I love that concept. They provide liquid body soap and shampoo... not sure about conditioner (I had my own). The soap smelled like melons. The sink cabinet had plenty of storage shelves to store your stuff. The shower head is the same one we have at home in our bathroom... a Kohler rain shower head. Overall, very nice bathroom.
reviews.title: Peaceful beach experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is spacious. Not huge, not small. Perfect for 2 people. It was a nice big bed (queen, or King, don't remember), firm but comfy. The air conditioner works well. The balcony is very big! We were surprised at how big it is! We had garden view and we loved it. I love tropical foliage and being out on the balcony made us feel like we were in our own private little jungle. The balcony was totally private with solid walls all the way up to the ceiling, so you do not see your neighbors on either side when you are on it.
reviews.title: OUR FAVORITE PLACE ON 7 MILE BEACH, PLEASANT STAFF

reviews.text: There was a big flat screen TV and a safe, both worked well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Wonderful Beach Spot

reviews.text: The beach area is in our opinion the nicest that we saw. The chairs, cushions and towels are all white which make the area bright and clean looking. The cushions float in the water but we never used them that way. The beach vendors do come by often but a firm -NO Thank You- will get most of them moving on their way. Hang tough and don't give in and don't say you'll get them later if you don't intend to. Just say -No Thank You-. My husband and I enjoyed joking around with the guys on the beach and we did buy some things from a few of them but again, a simple -No Thank You- works. I loved the fruit lady who carries the basked on her head and cuts the fruit right in front of you. I wish I had caught her name. She was sweet and very generous.
reviews.title: Solid boutique hotel on the beach

reviews.text: Very great place. We spent just a few days.The room was cleane and pretty but the location was orrible: the room was directly on the main road and it was too much noise to sleep. We escape from there cause of it.
reviews.title: Great but...

reviews.text: By the ways the other rooms look better the ours.
reviews.title: Our families favorite retreat!

reviews.text: We have come back to IdleAwhile for years.We arrive and kick off our shoes and never put them on again until we leave. Our son's were ages 3 and 7 on our first trip. It was the first vacation we had truly been able to relax. The layout of the property made it easy for our kids to be within sight at most times while we could lounge and read. The beach is immaculate and the water is shallow and calm. The restaurant is outdoors and the food is great because they use mostly local fruits and veggies. I still crave their red pea soup. We go back every chance we get. This is our ideal beach spot. One tip I have for travel to Jamaica is that the service anywhere you go is slow. So order your dinner before meltdown time, be prepared to wait anywhere you go.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem BUT For Couples Only!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took us over an hour to find Idle Awhile (it is really in the cut, far from civilization), but once we did it was totally worth the wait. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous: so spacious, flat screens, wi-fi, big bathroom, beautiful shower, kitchenette, and the wrap around porch with the hammock was definitely my favorite spot. Lush greenery all around, beautiful pool with a view. It was so serene and picturesque. Unfortunately, I was not there with a significant other, so the romantic charm was less important than being centrally located to all the action, so we checked out early. But if I come back to Negril with a significant other, this would definitely be the place. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating even when we expressed our desire to check-out early. My only complaints would be the hot water never got really hot, there was no iron in the room, and the loud noise of the landscapers/workers in the morning made it very difficult to sleep in late. Other than that, it was a perfect, beautiful Negril retreat! I'd just say keep in mind it is a 20 - 30 minute drive to all the fun spots on Norman Manley Blvd.
reviews.title: Classy oasis on the beach
Great, apart from the bathroom
reviews.text: There's no other place on 7-mile beach quite like Idle Awhile. It is truly a classy oasis on the beach. The desk staff are excellently professional (particularly Karim). Our suite was spacious, comfortable, clean with an elegant, subtle tropical design. The living area included a daybed, which was a nice touch. The air-conditioned bedroom was the perfect place to retire to after long days in the sun. Our patio was great, too, and we spent quite a bit of time there people-watching at Chill Awhile (the hotel's restaurant and bar). We were also just a few steps from the beach, which can't be beat. The staff set our chairs out every morning in just the spot we liked. And the chair pads that doubled as comfortable floats are definitely worth mentioning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at this most excellent property. The pluses are many - great staff, good food, best spot on the beach, great beach chairs, towels and floats. It has taken several days for my re-entry back into regular society - no-one has brought me a cappuccino on the beach for days! :(
reviews.title: Excellence on the beach

reviews.text: The room - We stayed in the Junior Suite, which is right behind the office. There was a little noise from the kitchen and office early in the morning, since we were up at the crack of dawn most days this did not bother us and it was usually brief. The Junior Suite has a nice kitchen with a small coffee maker, full size fridge and stove. As there were just the two of us, we did not use the loft area - it was a pretty steep climb. The AC units worked great, there were two of them and they kept the room nice and cool when we needed it. My only negative has been mentioned by many others - provide some light in the room! The rooms are pretty dark if you close the slatted windows for privacy. When IA replaces the ceiling fans they should consider getting ones with lights on them, it would go a long way to making the room brighter. That said, the best part of our room was the screened in porch. We spent a good bit of time out there; the chairs are a little more comfortable if you use one of the pillows from the room. And the hammock was great. The décor of the room was very well done, we loved the tile floors and the king bed was very comfy with excellent linens. The bathrooms have nice moisturizer, shower gel, and shampoo; bring your own conditioner. The bathroom in the Junior Suite is not open to the rest of the room, but it is open between the shower and toilet. There was some slanting between them, but you still got a little wet floor after a shower.
reviews.title: Not perfect, but very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff - Everyone we met was helpful, pleasant and had a great attitude. Some of the best customer service I have ever received. They remember your name and what you like to drink. I am not so great at names, and I'm sorry I didn't catch all of them. We were set up on the beach every day in our perfect spot (and do not worry - there are many perfect spots!) by the beach guy. The towels were great and plentiful. When you needed a cold drink - voila! It was right there at the bar or delivered on the beach. And they cheerfully refilled our cute Idle Awhile bottle with icey water whenever asked.
reviews.title: pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food/drink - We ate breakfast in the room all but one morning. It was delivered quickly, no island time! I had at least one cappuccino on the beach every day. For those that grouse about the prices, we found them to be quite reasonable and try finding a Starbucks that has cappuccino on the beach for that price! We ate lunch there once, just cheeseburgers and fries. Cheeseburgers were pretty good but small (I'd ask for a double if I went again) and the French Fries were perfect crispy delights. Our one dinner at the property was very good. We only planned to eat there once and were sorry we didn't wait and go there the night of the music and buffet, which is Friday. That said, I had the special which was a very good snapper with coconut cream sauce, my DH had the escovietch fish which was pretty good, but not really his cup of tea. And after appetizers and soup he wasn’t that hungry.
reviews.title: Another wonderful experience at Idle Awhile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property itself is plush and tropical. Another plus was that while this is a small property, it was full of a variety of guests and we got to meet many very nice people while we were there. We would stay again if we could get in, they get booked a year in advance. Now I know why.
reviews.title: Pure Bliss in Negril at Idle Awhile

reviews.text: A group of us...(6)....just completed a 5 day journey to Negril. Some in our group have been going to JA for over 25 years......others 10 years or so. All of us were very impressed with everything about Idle Awhile. The rooms were spacious....comfortable.....clean.....nicely decorated. Bathrooms very nicely appointed and clean. Housekeeping was outstanding....got on the rooms early if you so choosed and did a marvelous job. The food and bar area was wonderful. The grounds were meticulous and lush. The beachfront area clean and comfortable....the setting pristine. Beach loungers and cushions cleaned daily...all the fresh towels you needed. The facility set us up with a great driver for our off-site journeys and he was professional safe and prompt.The location was perfect....both from a beach aspect and main street aspect. We also spent a half day at the sister resort in the cliffs...Hide Awhile. Again...everything there was just as tight and wonderful....everything....staff included. I personally have been to some very nice facilities in JA and this establishment ranks with them in all regards. As a businessman I can tell you that it appears to me that the upper management of this organization are very sharp....as they have surrounded themselves with very good employees in every sector of the business. Many of these employees have been there for a good number of years. This tells me those employees are taken care of and like their work. And this shows. To be uber successful in the Hotel/Food industry....it takes a great crew of people and Idle Awhile has that. There was great teamwork amongst them and they all did a great job in making our stay wonderful. Thank you and I am sure you will see some of us....if not all of us..... again. Alex Gariup.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are thinking of staying on the beach in Negril and may not want to book all inclusive, consider this lovely South Beach style boutique hotel on the seven mile beach.
reviews.title: A sweet and lovely spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A boutique hotel designed by Jane Issa (Head Designer of Couples hotels) - it is not only very hip and chic, but caters to families and children too. The staff are non comparable and lovely - the bar staff - especially Carlton and the crew are just always friendly and efficient!
reviews.title: Simply divine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not a glitzy or bling hotel, but it has what I call "class" - and that is so important.
reviews.title: Superb location

reviews.text: It is located in the middle of the seven mile beach and has lovely chairs and a very South Beach style wooden deck with a shell themed Bar....good drinks and the food is always yummy. Again, it not a formal setting, so enjoy it for what it is - classy, fun, hip and very sweet.
reviews.title: Hide Awhile on the Cliffs

reviews.text: the room was huge and clean and all in all the room was 4.5 out of 5. we hated the seven mile beach and all the local that come up to bother you. we prefered the cliff seen. staff was very nice. i thought the place overall could have been better for $190 a night. but i enjoyed the hotel minus the beach.
reviews.title: nice rooms did not like 7 mile

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 4-nights at Idle Awhile and loved every minute. The rooms are very nice. The bed was comfortable, room always clean, the air-conditioning worked really well and the staff were GREAT! It was SO nice to stay at two places with such friendly staff memebers (Tensing Pen is the other)! Last year we stayed at Couples Negril & the Rockhouse and the staff were okay, but never went out of their way to really welcome you or make friends with you. We spent a lot of time talking to Marc & Sonia from the beach bar. Lawrence, Romeo & Leston (security) also were fun to chat with and they took good care of us. Every morning Lawrence had our beach chairs sat out for us before we were even out of bed(now that is going out of your way)! We also LOVED the outside porch. We took a nap every day on the outside couch, it was SO relaxing (and romantic). The beach was really nice too. It had a great location & even though it was small it never felt crowded. We scoped out all of the other hotels nearby on 7-mile and we felt Idle Awhile was the best by far (excluding Moondance of course). The few meals we ate there were great (we only had breakfast & lunch).
reviews.title: Loved Idle Awhile!

reviews.text: Regarding the recent review about theft--I felt extremely safe there and never had any problems with any of our stuff.
reviews.title: Best place on the beach!

reviews.text: The only negative was the water. It was disgusting tasting! I don't know why it was so bad because at all other places we were the water was great. Buy a big bottle water for your refridgerator before your stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful Island, Beautiful People!

reviews.text: I've been to Negril twice ('05 and '03) and both times I stayed at Idleawhile. It is absolutely wonderful. The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. The louvered windows are awesome, and I enjoyed the sounds of the tree frogs at night. The rooms and the foliage on the grounds are even more beautiful than they look on the website. I refer people to this resort all the time and will continue to do so. If I ever pay another visit to Negril, I would not even look around to stay anywhere else. By your second day, you feel like your at home. The beach is gorgeous, don't let anyone tell you differently! My first trip was just me and my best friend and we were completely taken care of and looked after. Carlton the bartender is super awesome. The environment is very laid back, so as soon as you begin to get hungry you need to order your food, b/c it does take about 30 minutes. * The red snapper is great all over Negril, but be sure that it's not the whole fish which has it's eyes and can be disturbing to look at, much less eat. Eat lunch at the Rockhouse and have one dinner at the Hungry Lion. Both of these are at the cliffs. Most of all, stay at Idleawhile, you will not be disappointed, I promise!
reviews.title: Honest review of Idle Awhile
Best hotel on Negril beach
reviews.text: Among the Negril regulars, Idle Awhile is one of the best boutique hotels. It is well known. This was my first visit to Negril. I loved Idle Awhile. My boyfriend and I spent a lot of time walking the beach and agree that IA has the best beach, nicest rooms, good security, good beach chairs, nice bar, great staff, and is more upscale than most other places (Without being too expensive). The breakfst is really nice here and the lunches are good-try the fish and chips. There are many other restaurants on the beach: our favorites were Norma's at Seasplash, Kuyaba (pricey), and BEst of the west jerk chicken stand across the street.

reviews.title: Idle Awhile the Best of Negril - 5 Stars!
reviews.text: No worries at this place. It is a boutique hotel though--don't forget, they don't have 24 hr. service, there is a small safe in the rooms (which are very tropical--louvers, wonderful patio, nice breeze, AC, fan, small fridge. Very clean. mostly couples (not a spring breaker type place). Ask for an upper floor room. We stayed in a normal deluxe room and it was plenty of space. Very nice!!

reviews.title: We had a wonderful time at Idle A While
reviews.text: Overall, IA is your best choice on this beach. Negril on the other hand, we found to be just ok. Very relaxing, but got a lot of hassle from beach vendors while walking up and down the beach. People offering you pot are everywhere--this can get annoying, but won't ruin your trip.

reviews.title: A great place to relax!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at Idle Awhile 4 nights and have nothing but good things to say about the accomodations, staff and overall experience. We don't care for the large all-inclusives, yet still wanted something with a touch of class, full-service amenities and personal service. The prices for the rooms here are very reasonable and our deluxe ocean view room was just as described and pictured. It was cleaned every day with fresh towels and linens and was very comfortable, stylish and had a great view. Definitely felt like 5-star luxury in our opinion. The restaurant on the beach has a great breakfast menu. We recommend the traditional Jamaican style breakfast for $10.00 which offers a great variety of traditional items. The drinks were great, particularly the pina coladas! They make it far too convenient with running a room tab so you can pay up when you depart. Nice not to worry about cash, funds, tipping, etc. while on the beach. We never had dinner at the restaurant, though ordered their club sandwiches a couple times for lunch. They were good and reasonable for $7.00. The shuttle to/from the Montego Bay airport was very smooth and reliable. Driver both directions was prompt, professional and trustworthy. The staff was very accomodating and the quaint resort had plenty of safety measures and nighttime security just for extra comfort. The rooms each have a safe which is very handy for excess cash, passports, and valuables. We would absolutely recommend this place to our friends and anyone looking for accomodations on the upper mid-level scale. You can't go wrong at Idle Awhile. We met other guests during our stay that were repeat visitors to the resort. They have a wonderful beach, plenty of recliners, provide fresh beach towels and tons of restaurants and bars to choose from in walking distance along the beach. Definitely recommend Kuyaba just about a 10 minute walk down the beach -- and also Cosmos about a 15 minute walk, had great jerk chicken and a great menu much cheaper than other places. No need for taxis or to walk on the busy main road. The location is truly on the main Negril stretch. Photos of the resort are attached. We have stayed at other 5-star resorts (St. Lucia, Barbados and other countries) and feel that this was one of our best finds yet and the total price was more than reasonable.

reviews.title: What a way to love life!!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Idle a While while in Negril Jamacia. This is where we would go back too. The staff was more than accomidating. As a matter of fact their wonderful bartender (who we have a picture for and will be sending )used his day off to show us some of the out of the way beautiful sights on their awesome islland. Our room at Idle a while was very clean, the room had a lot of character and a Jamacian feel, the food was wonderful. We got up in the morning and opened the curtains and there was the beautiful ocean. Went to breakfast in our bare feet, to drink a wonderfully fresh fruit drink made fresh each day and eat delicious banana pancakes and fruit in season. Our lawn chairs and umbrellas were set out for us each day by security. Any time a beach sales person would come up to us and ask if we wanted to make a purchase the wonderful security at Idle a While would come and ask us if all was ok. They even helped us cross the street (watch for cars) when my husband would go across the street to get his soda drink. We had to move the last night as we did not make our reservations early enough. We left for the day and came back and all was done for us. The front desk staff were more than accomidating any time we had a question or a concern. I cannot think of a place I have stayed in my travels, which have been many, that was more accomidating than Idel A While. Fresh, beautiful ocean and vegetatian, I cant wait to go back, a piece of my soul stayed. Thank you to all of you at Idle A While.
